Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: tlvfrhm
Reviews.Content: Spent the night here and found the staff as friendly and helpful as I have at other Red Roof Inns. Room was clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Very basic”
Reviews.Author: funtimetravels
Reviews.Content: Booked on line last minute great rate clean room slept good

Reviews.Title: “Golf Trip”
Reviews.Author: Ron S
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay for the price range. Clean and a good bed. Alicia at the front desk was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Basic Value Accomodations”
Reviews.Author: 2010yvr
Reviews.Content: Needed a place to hang my hat when here on buisness without the family. Very basic accomodations but served my purpose. Free wi-fi and coffe in lobby was nice.Have to say that the area is not great.Clientel a little spotty.OK to come and go but would not make it a stay with the family. Think truck stop.Staff was good.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay and excellent staff!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Bessie W
Reviews.Content: My husband dog and I checked in, and shortly after arriving to our room, we received a call from the reception area asking if the room meet our needs...wow. I did not even receive such courtesy at hotels, such as the Mirage in Vegas.Hotel was nice and clean, and the staff was super courteous. I will be staying here again if in the area!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: KennethB5
Reviews.Content: Have sayed here twice a year for years and have always had great friendly service. Rooms are clean and good sized. The service rates right up there with many of the large top chain hotels.Other companies need to find out who trains their staff and hire them.

Reviews.Title: “nice quite room to relax”
Reviews.Author: oscar m
Reviews.Content: thank to Alica she helped us from the moment we walked in she makes the stay more conferring

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay At A Great Price”
Reviews.Author: LaTrisha E
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at this hotel. We needed a good price on a good room that was pet friendly and this Red Roof delivered. The room was a good size and came with a fridge and microwave which was very helpful. Since we had our puppy with us we needed a room on the first floor and Kim at the front desk delivered. She even got us close to the exit so we could come and go easily. The hotel is located close to freeway, lots of stores and places to eat. I would recommend this hotel to anyone including friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Earl sez its the 'Cat's Meow!'”
Reviews.Author: danelady1
Reviews.Content: I'm an over the road trucker,traveling with my great dane,Earl. I drive for Swift and if my truck has to go in the shop this is where we stay. Or if I just want some R&R and to sleep in a real bed,I drop the trailer at our nearby terminal and bobtail over,and I always leave here well rested. Every single member of the staff is very friendly,from Bobby the manager to Kim at the front desk and all of housekeeping. Bobby printed out my boarding pass when I took a flight out of here last month,and Kim has been a big help to me today by giving me some pointers on how to use my brand new smart phone. These people go above and beyond what is required of them and are a credit to their company.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: iammark
Reviews.Content: Kim and the staff here has made me feel like a very important guest. Because my stay here has been so pleasant, I will not hesitate to stay here again. Thank You.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay every time”
Reviews.Author: atjen
Reviews.Content: I first came to your inn/ when employed by heartland express/ each time i m there/ eveything is just great/ i live in calif/ but when on vacation passing through phoenix with friends/ i made your inn our resting place/ saving the best for last / you have a young lady that work/ and i mean work at your inn name kim/ she and others that work with her/ makes sure that all the customer are well taken care of/ kim just don't stay behind her front counter/ but i notice her often/ checking each floor to make sure things are kept in order/ i know you have thousand of customers who visit your inn yearly/ but kim have never forgotten by name/ and it been two years ago when i first step into your inn/ WOW! YOURS TRUELY CHARLIE charlie.gaines55@yahoo.com

Reviews.Title: “Pleased with my time at Phoenix West”
Reviews.Author: yayhasplz
Reviews.Content: I booked a few nights at this Red Roof inn knowing that I would be returning the following week and staying in the area again, but wanted to check it out before I committed to the second week at this hotel. I was very pleased. The first trip I was on the third floor in a king room with an office center (that means a desk in the corner). The staff is polite and helpful, and I booked through orbitz. This is a no-frills hotel, but it had some amenities that I didn't find in much more expensive rooms. I had a microwave and a fridge, as well as a little coffemaker. In my book those are pretty valuable. If there was a downside it's the color scheme of the bedspread and curtains, but hey...for 54.00/night I can ignore that. The hotel is fairly quiet, I didn't experience any loud noise or issues with traffic, even though it is right off the freeway. I'm told that this isn't the safest of areas, but what I took that to mean was don't walk around outside alone at night.... so I didn't. Otherwise it didn't look 'ghetto' to me...there was a McDonalds less than a block away, as well as Burger King, Taco Bell, Carls JR, a QT station and several other things that made my stay pretty easy. I had to travel a bit for better food than that, but it was fine. My second stay was in the same type of room but on the ground floor, and again I had no issues. I wish they had better linens and towels, but the price was a huge factor here since I was staying for an extended period of time.... so I can make do with thin towels. I would definitely recommend this as a relatively clean, well managed and comfortable place to stay in phoenix on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Sweet Deal”
Reviews.Author: Iheartny_82
Reviews.Content: The room was nice, and clean, and staff was professional. I have never stayed at a Red Roof Inn hotel before, but would definitely stay again. I had to check out early and the staff was nice enough to refund me for the nights I did not stay. Good location in a nice neighborhood as well.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: Bill J
Reviews.Content: Was surprised at how nice for the price. Staff was great, room was clean and in good condition with exception of the door not locking without working at it. Will stay here again when in Phoenix. No problem with recommending this motel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, safe, affordable”
Reviews.Author: HappyTrails916
Reviews.Content: Conveniently located right off freeway, near McDonalds and gas station. Free coffee, no breakfast. Room was clean, doors locked in back after 9pm, security guard after hours, room was clean, price was good. No complaints. Great place for travelers on budget who want the basics. Brochure rack of attractions for vacationers. This beats all the budget motels like Motel 6 and Super 8, where you pay more for less and rooms aren't always clean and location not well lighted or as secure. Overnight staff was very helpful and nice, a great change from some places where staff can be brusque. Our clerk even suggested we check online for better rate for the same room before we booked. Highly recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: Dennis J
Reviews.Content: I am writing just to tell you that I enjoyed my stay at the Red Roof Inn, in Phoenix, Arizona. Every staff member was always in a professional mood throughout my stay. I highly reccommmend anyone to stay at this Red Roof Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable stay!”
Reviews.Author: kellywarner
Reviews.Content: Scince I've been here at the Red Roof Inn in west Phoenix, I've been very pleased with the hospitality of the staff here! The management here is great to be around, if I needed anything such as a clean room, fresh towels, hot coffee, they made sure I was accommodate! Kim the manager here is great to be around! She is great to be around in the lobby and makes me smile whenever she works!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay!”
Reviews.Author: Cliffy_tbrd
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our stay of 5 nights with our church youth group. The front desk worker named Kim made eveything a breeze and really impressed all of us with her attitude and professionalism.

Reviews.Title: “nice, clean but very worn”
Reviews.Author: gfron1
Reviews.Content: Chairs are ripped with heavy stains. Tub caulking is peeling off badly. Curtains are very dated. But this old room is well cleaned and desk staff was very friendly and fast.

Reviews.Title: “To Be Expected”
Reviews.Author: kerriphillps68
Reviews.Content: I travel to Red Roof Inns' all across the country and when I travel to Phoenix every year I stay at the Red Roof Inn in West Phoenix. I always feel comfortable staying here. Every member of the staff is always willing to help out with anything that comes their direction. I especially reccommend David who works the late night hours because he knows how to be serious when it is need and has a sense of humor when times are a bit tough. I do also consider the afternoon guest service representative who tries her hardest to please every guest everytime. I will most definately come back to this hotel when the next time I travel to the Phoenix area. Thank you all!

Reviews.Title: “Superb!”
Reviews.Author: DebraD27
Reviews.Content: Stayed here twice and loved it everytime.. The front desk staff is amazing, kind courteous. I would recommend staying here the prices are cheap everyone is more than friendly. The rooms are clean. I've never had a problem here and will stay here anytime!

Reviews.Title: “Red Roof Inn has been the best in service for many of years.”
Reviews.Author: Shamrock7504
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Red Roof Inn was one of the most enjoyable stays thus far. I travel a lot with the military and on my own time and I always end up at many of different hotels but this hotel has given me great service and the room is nice and very spacious. The front desk Clerk, Kim, was very interactive as well and that gives me a welcoming feeling from the beggining to the end of my stay. Thanks to all the staff here.

Reviews.Title: “Steer Clear”
Reviews.Author: TravelDiva67
Reviews.Content: Hotel pictures make it look decent. When you pull into parking lot, shady characters, elevator smelled like pot. Windows screwed shut, rooms stink and a/c don't work all that well for 98 degrees. Hotel staff seemed friendly, but not overally accomdating. We stayed four nights and they didn't change our sheets, and did not clean our room except to empty trash. I addressed it with Desk staff and they gave me lame excuses for their staff not cleaning the room. They did not make the bed because I left a empty deodorant box on bed, they came to clean while we were there and housekeeping didn't speak English at all and it made it hard to communicate what we needed. She gave us new towels and we had to chase her down to give her the trash and get more coffee. Again I addressed with front desk and lame excuse was when guests are in the room they can only give you towels for their safety. I understand safeguards but they could have communicated that to me and I would have gladly left to get it properly taken care of.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: donjohnson097
Reviews.Content: I had stayed there back in March of 2011. I had a great experience. From the first moment I arrived in the middle of the night the male night clerk was always in a great mood helping me in any way possible. The femaie desk attendant was also helpful in a positive attitude. I don't know the names of the clerks but, he does look he knows what he is doing along with everyone else they have on staff.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for and nothing else”
Reviews.Author: ColoCane
Reviews.Content: This is a value priced hotel and that's what you get. Very convenient to 1-10--less than a minute away. The neighborhood is best described as "seedy" and a number of homeless people and transients are close by at night. When we first arrived at about 11PM, the doors were locked and we had to bang on the window to have someone let us in--this took 4-5 minutes with some "concerning" people close to us. I'm a big city guy, and even I wasn't very confortable in the parking lot after dark. The access road was in very poor condition with dangerous suspension-crushing potholes. The facility itself is OK. Clean, nice common areas. Rooms are small (no big deal) and are about what expect you'd expect at this price point. However, the lighting in the rooms is dim and inadequate, which made our room look like a prison cell when we arrived late. Much better in the morning. Two major issues: there is no continental breakfast--just coffee. So if you want to get something light to eat (bagel, pastry) you have to walk to a convenience store a block away--a real annoyance. There is no public computer or printer, so if you don't go through the hassle of bringing your own, you're stuck. The front desk will print a boarding pass if you give them the confirmation number (when they get around to it) but you can't check email if you don't have your confirmation number so there's no other way to print--my friend had to check in at the airport. Staff was OK--nothing special and a few a little unpleasant. They tried to stick on that "safe fee" even after told them to remove it. Know what you're getting (and not getting) and it's marginally OK for travelers on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Patmillikin
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Red Roof hotels all across the USA. This is the best one. Clean, affordable, not too far from the airport. No breakfast, but there are 6 fast food places within one block. I would recomend this place for anyone looking for a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for an overnighter.”
Reviews.Author: txsgirl
Reviews.Content: The first room we checked into was on the first floor. I sat down on the toliet and I got soaked from wter coming from the ceiling. I told the lady at the front desk. She immediately moves our room and addressed the problem. Staff is very friendly. Very family friendly. Beds not so great. I can feel the springs. They have smoking and non smoking rooms right next to each other so you can defiantly smell the smoke.

Reviews.Title: “NFL game in Phoenix”
Reviews.Author: Richandstell
Reviews.Content: Conveniently located near the Cardinals stadium and many restaurants. Well run front desk, clean and roomy king room with frig and microwave, pet friendly. Would be nice to add a continental breakfast instead of just coffee and tea in lobby, but price is very affordable so I guess lack of breakfast keeps costs down.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed My stay”
Reviews.Author: Pete1104
Reviews.Content: I spend 5 to 8 days in Phoenix every month on business. I have switched Red Roof because of their value, clean rooms and how easy it is to book my room on-line. Their staff is always pleasent and ready to help.

Reviews.Title: “Best Service and Courtesy”
Reviews.Author: piratesbluff
Reviews.Content: On short notice I contacted the motel and was accomodated without hesitation. The staff is friendly, courteous and helpful. Rooms were recently upgraded to include free Wi-Fi. Whenever I called the front desk the staff was more than willing to see that I had what I needed. My thanks to Bobbie, Marlene and especially Kim. Rich W.

Reviews.Title: “Nice value for the cost.”
Reviews.Author: SENM-Traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on the way to and coming back from a L.A. trip. Nothing fancy. You get what you pay for. Room was clean, a/c and cable worked. I felt comfortable with my family staying at this hotel. Very busy hotel, or at least while we were there. Spring training. Got a better rate by using an online booking site weeks ahead of our stay. Extra towels were no problem. The pool was heated and clean. A couple carpet stains, not a big deal to us. The beds were a bit hard but comfortable. Asked for and got a room on the top floor oposite the interstate.

Reviews.Title: “Ministry”
Reviews.Author: Evie777
Reviews.Content: Oh don't ever go during this time of the year! It was 117 degrees and I was miserable! The hotel had graffitti on the wall next to the east entrance and I did not feel safe. The room needed to be updated, however, the air conditioning worked very well. Service was average.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, close to freeway.....get what you paid for.”
Reviews.Author: Theaterbelle
Reviews.Content: This motel is good if you absolutely must stay in phoenix on a budget. No frills, nothing around it, but its clean, safe and cheap. My husband and I were moving from san diego to denver and this was out first stop. Its a place to sleep....not much else I can say about it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rockenro
Reviews.Content: Its a very nice hotel, it was clean, good location close from walmart, restaurant etc.. also has security for the parking lot at night that's a plus overall pretty good the only thing I would recommend is a hair dryer and ironing board also more shampoo

Reviews.Title: “Watch out for the Hookers”
Reviews.Author: ChattTraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a tournament and there were lots of players there, and there were also hookers looking for some action. Next door at the McDonald's we were informed by some boys that walked over for breakfast, that there were about 8 crack-heads out back. We noticed there was an obvious stash of sleeping supplies for some street person on the front patio of McD's. Made us feel uncomfortable about the neighborhood to say the least. The staff was very pleasant and friendly. The rooms were clean. The pool got a lot of leaves from some strong winds, and it wasn't cleaned out for two days. Not much to say about the coffee/hot chocolate machine, unless you like bad coffee and questionable chocolate. Bed was comfortable, and aside from some drunks upstairs making a lot of racket, I guess we got our monies worth.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant, cooperative staff; enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: Chelydra
Reviews.Content: A four-story building (ground floor with three floors above) parallel to and facing Interstate 10. The building has internal corridors and parking on all sides. After leaving Exit 139, from 51st Avenue going north take the first left-turn lane to enter W. Willetta St. (a Holiday Inn sits on the corner). From W. McDowell Road turn into N. 52nd Drive (you will see a Motel 6) which curves and becomes W. Willetta St. During our week-long stay we found all the desk staff pleasant, cooperative and helpful — especially (Kim who checked us in) and David. We would return to the motel. If you prefer a quieter room, request one on the top (4th) floor towards either end of the corridor (for instance, end rooms 401 or 435 which look out from the ends of the building) and away from the elevator, vending-ice machines and housekeepers’ storage area. Prefer rooms which face the vacant lot (at the time of writing) across W. Willetta St. at the front of the building rather than rooms which face the Interstate (which has the constant drone of passing traffic). Avoid connecting doors between rooms — unless you need them. We had an end room on the third floor and found the soundproofing between the floors adequate (you could just hear water flow in the room above). A gap between the bottom of the room door and the carpeting (inevitably) admitted noise from the corridor. Except for the brief whine of a housekeeper’s vacuum cleaner in the morning (after 9 a.m. on) and the occasional door left to slam closed by another guest, we did not find this a problem during our stay. Note that housekeeping will leave only one sachet of shampoo in each room; hence, you will have to ask for extra from housekeeping in the morning or from the reception desk when housekeeping has finished servicing all the rooms. Guests would find it beneficial if the Accor chain could manage to provide: two sachets of shampoo in each room as part of standard provisions instead of one, Do Not Disturb signs to hang outside the room door, channels TCM and AMC in addition to the (limited) selection offered, and a free Internet terminal in the lobby for those people who do not travel encumbered with a laptop computer. On the positive side, this particular motel did have good staff overall, a 24-hour automatic coffee machine which also dispensed hot chocolate and hot water for tea, and a morning newspaper left outside the door. We found useful the McDonald’s a 1-2 minute walk across the road. You can also find a Mexican restaurant and a supermarket in a shopping plaza you can walk to conveniently at the NW corner of 51st Avenue and W. McDowell Road.

Reviews.Title: “Wireless Internet extra charge.”
Reviews.Author: StephenMarks
Reviews.Content: Stayed here because of online deal, otherwise wouldn't have. Hotel is basic. Coffee in lobby but nothing else. Wireless Internet is $11 dollars extra per day as it is a T-Mobile Hotspot but add only said that wireless is available in all rooms. Room was clean. Budget rates.

Reviews.Title: “nothing special at all...”
Reviews.Author: steveo3002
Reviews.Content: a very average and bland place to stay...fairly clean id suggest you keep searching ...nothing special at all

Reviews.Title: “Nice staff, clean and quiet stay”
Reviews.Author: RLNTSTR
Reviews.Content: Pretty much just a clean quiet place to stay. No coffee maker, iron, or anything extra in the rooms. Had to ask for extra blanket and iron and ironing board. Paid more than it's worth due to Nascar race weekend. Nice stay. Would recommend if just need a place to sleep that is clean and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Worked out Great”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This place was a great find! The room was clean and the hotel was in a great location. The staff was very nice and helpful in helping me find my way around. I would stay here again if i was to visit that area again.

HotelInfo.Name: Red Roof Inn Phoenix West
HotelInfo.Address: 5215 West Willetta, Phoenix, AZ 85043
